intro: Heterosperma trilobum, commonly known as the three-lobed water clover, is a aquatic plant characterized by its delicate, floating leaves that are divided into three lobes. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is native to tropical and subtropical regions. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Heterosperma trilobum is often found in still or slow-moving freshwater habitats, such as ponds and marshes. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
